intro: Acosmium fallax, commonly known as the Florida acosmium, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several states.
